communication.description: Any scientific instrument carried by a space probe or an artificial satellite
communication.extended: A space detector is a sensor supported by another device that let it collect data, that is deployed into a spacecraft and works outside Earth lower atmosphere

propulsion.description: The set of subsystems needed to make a spacecraft moving in space
propulsion.extended: Complex devices-subsystems used for impelling (processes of applying a force which results in translational motion) a spacecraft, in the specific http://umbel.org/umbel/rc/ProjectilePropelling

detector.description: Any scientific instrument carried by a space probe or an artificial satellite
detector.extended: A space detector is a sensor supported by another device that let it collect data, that is deployed into a spacecraft and works outside Earth lower atmosphere

primary power.description: The set of subsystems needed to make a spacecraft to collect energy to operate
primary power.extended: Complex devices-subsystems used for collecting energy.

backup power.description: The set of subsystems needed to make a spacecraft to store energy from the primary power source.
backup power.extended: The set of subsystems needed to make a spacecraft to store energy from the primary power source.

thermal.description: Artifacts or devices used to maintain the temperature of spacecraft's subsystems and payloads into a given range, to permit nominal and survival mode for all the duration of the mission .
thermal.extended: Shields, shells or any device insulation from/reflecting radiation exploiting emission and absorption events

structure.description: Artifacts or rigid devices used to create a supporting structure for all the others devices.
structure.extended: It's the skeleton and framework of the spacecraft.

command and data.description: Command and Data Handling, it is the device that connects the other devices, it processes and deliver information.
command and data.extended: The DH system shall: Enable HK and science data flow – Housekeeping data (Temperatures, Pressures, Voltages, Currents, Status,...) – Attitude data – Payload data (e.g., Science data) - Receive and distribute commands - Perform TM and TC protocols - Distribute timing signals - Synchronization of data – Time stamping of data - Provide data storage - Execute commands and schedules - Control subsystems and payloads - Monitor spacecraft health - Make autonomous decisions - Perform data compression.

attitude and orbit control.description: Complex devices-subsystems used to set the direction and the position of the spacecraft, it controls flight dynamics.
